item.title: Answer for What is the differences between DWQA and Forum?
item.dc:creator: Vernon Dahmer
item.content:encoded: @ Antawn Fiennes, I think DWQA will focus on giving the best solutions for a specific customer. For furum, it's a best place to share thoughts, experiences and knowledge as well.

item.title: Answer for What is the differences between DWQA and Forum?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
Very cool question, my friend. It makes me a little bit confused :D
Ohm, at first glance, we will think that they are both the same in function. Both forum and Q&A are a place where people have the ability to ask questions about the product/service/problem they are interested and wait for responses.
Even if they look the same from the outside, they are very different on the inside.
Forum.
An online forum is a discussion area. A topic of discussion is posted and people can respond, discuss, give their own ideas or evoke further conversations…Of course, you can get several answers but some of which will be nothing and the question ended inconclusively.
Q&A
Although, the Q & A is similar to a “forum-style” of open, free for discussion like Quora or Stack Overflow but, on Q&A you will get specific answers that are 100% related to your question. It means that Q & A is very directed toward problem solving.
In addition, users can pick the best answer, which will then float to the top making it more easier for other users to find out.
Regarding the interaction and community, the Q & A isn’t as strong as forum.
I hope this answer is useful and have a nice day.

item.title: Answer for How to pin a sticky question to the top of the questions page?
item.dc:creator: Vernon Dahmer
item.content:encoded: You can pin a question by navigating to backend of that question.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: It's great, thanks :)
Thanks @Vernon Dahmer.

item.title: Answer for How to pin a sticky question to the top of the questions page?
item.dc:creator: Vernon Dahmer
item.content:encoded: It would be a good thing if DW Question & Answer adds the feature "pin a post" at the front-end for administrator.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I don't have that option either..
I vote this cool idea, too!
I will seriously consider this thought.

item.title: Answer for How to pin a sticky question to the top of the questions page?
item.dc:creator: Vernon Dahmer
item.content:encoded: Only group administrators have the option of pinning a question. The option is not available at the front-end.

item.title: Answer for How to pin a sticky question to the top of the questions page?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Very easy to do it, just navigate to Dashboard >> Questions >> All Question, pick the question you want to pin, keep the option "Pin question to top of archive page" checked as follows:

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: That does not work. there is no way to pin to top. I can not find out it.
Please update the latest version of DWQA, this bug fixed.
Ya you are right. Thanks for your great help.

item.title: Answer for How do I require a password if I forgot it?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
To get your password back:
  1. Click on My Account in the top right of the page.
  2. Click login
  3. Click the link “Forgot password?”
  4. Enter your email that you used to register before.

item.title: Answer for How do I require a password if I forgot it?
item.dc:creator: Shan Judd
item.content:encoded: It's helpful, thank you very much. :)

item.title: Answer for What is notifications in backend of DWQA?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Notifications are updates about activities in DWQA such as new questions, new comments and new answers. You can turn off notifications by keep the option "enable notification" unchecked.

item.title: Answer for What is notifications in backend of DWQA?
item.dc:creator: Shan Judd
item.content:encoded: Ok, That's done. I love it

item.title: Answer for How do I edit my notification settings?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
To edit your notification settings, go to Dashboard >> Questions >> Settings >> Notifications. From here, you can select:
  • Email for new questions
  • Email for new answers
  • Email for new comments?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Thanks for your help.

item.title: Answer for Where do I edit my notification settings?
item.dc:creator: Kiki Ralp
item.content:encoded: As far as I know it will only Edit in backend. If you want to turn off this setting, just uncheck.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Alright, it works.

item.title: Answer for Where do I edit my notification settings?
item.dc:creator: Vernon Dahmer
item.content:encoded: Thank you.

item.title: Answer for I'm not receiving email notifications.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
We're working on sending fewer emails for people who use our DWQA often and primarily get notifications while logged in. If you want to select what email notifications you get:
  1. Go to your backend >> Questions >> Settings >> Notifications.
  2. Choose if you want to receive all notifications, important notifications or only notifications about your account
If you're still having issues with email notifications, try these troubleshooting tips:
  • Make sure you setup the general settings.
  • Check your spam or junk email filter to make sure that emails coming from the site used DWQA aren't being placed in this folder.
  • If you're still not receiving emails, please contact your ISP (Internet Service Provider) to ensure that they aren't blocking email traffic.
  • If the issue continues, please let us know here.

item.title: Answer for When I search for someone, I can't find them.
item.dc:creator: Vernon Dahmer
item.content:encoded:
There are a few reasons you might not be able to find someone using search:
  • This plugin doesn’t support this feature :D
  • Your search isn’t specific enough.
Pls check a gain.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I don't think so. I checked carefully with many cases.
Deactivate all plugins and activate one-by-one to check the problem.
I deactivate all plugins, but nothing changes.

item.title: Answer for When I search for someone, I can't find them.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Thanks for letting us know this point. That's bug from our plugin. We will check and fix it as soon as possible.

item.title: Answer for How can I participate in a Q&A?
item.dc:creator: Vernon Dahmer
item.content:encoded: To participate in a Q&A, write a question in the box in the Q&A and press the Submit button. Keep in mind that your question was asked before. So, search to have the results before dropping a question.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: That's right. @Antawn, pls follow the instruction above for writing a question.

item.title: Answer for How do I upload photos or videos directly on DWQA?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Hi, Currently, our DWQA allows uploading images with URL link, not from your computer because of the security. It's difficult to use a little, but will protect your site from spam or risk files.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: If I want this function at the front-end, can you help me?
We know you want this feature, but your site will be in danger and spammer / hacker can upload a file contained virus into the live site. It's not worth.

item.title: Answer for Do DWQA moderate new questions?
item.dc:creator: Kiki Ralp
item.content:encoded: I have the question, just logged into Dashboard >> Questions >> Settings >> General. Make sure that you checked the option "Question must be manually approved".

item.title: Answer for Who can post ratings and reviews?
item.dc:creator: Vernon Dahmer
item.content:encoded: Anyone logged into your website can post ratings for the questions and answers.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: However, the up/down arrows next to each question and answer are clickable when anonymous users hover over.
Don't worry, number of the votes still remain, not count if anonymous users click.

item.title: Answer for Who can post ratings and reviews?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Hi, Only users logged into your website can vote for the questions and answers. With anonymous, this function will not be applied.

item.title: Answer for Where I can see or edit ratings I've posted?
item.dc:creator: Antawn Fiennes
item.content:encoded: You can give the question / answer a vote up / vote down, but you can not edit it.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: In back-end, I can not find where I can edit this. I think this feature is needed for my site.

item.title: Answer for Where I can see or edit ratings I've posted?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Currently, DWQA only supports for voting up or down at the front-end. You can not edit the vote anywhere.

item.title: Answer for How do I write a question in more than one language?
item.dc:creator: Vernon Dahmer
item.content:encoded: DWQA is supposed to work for us, see our gripes and take heed. WE NEED THIS FEATURE, especially when you have many customers over the world.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I know what you want. However, it's not easy to develop this feature for DWQA plugin. We want to keep the core of DWQA very simple and clean. If there are many functions added, the core will become complex and not easy to use.
You can give a suggestion for this?
I think you can use third-party plugin to support this.
I will try, thanks for your response.

item.title: How to make Question list page shown automatically after question is posted ?
item.dc:creator: Vernon Dahmer
item.content:encoded: How to make question list page automatically shown after the questions is submitted by users?

item.title: Answer for How to make Question list page shown automatically after question is posted ?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
To redirect users to a different page or list questions when user submit a answer, please open the wp-content/plugins/dw-question-answer/inc/Posts/Answer.php file. Find the line 408.
Replace the following code: 
// wp_redirect( get_permalink( $question_id ) ); // wp_send_json_success( array( 'url' => get_permalink( $question_id ) ) ); // return true;
With new code: 
wp_redirect('https://your-site.com'); wp_send_json_success( array( 'url' => get_permalink( $question_id ) ) ); return true;
To redirect users to a different page when user submit a question, please open the Question.php file in the folder path wp-content -> plugins -> dw-question-answer -> inc -> Post -> Question.phpfile. Find the line code around line 439: 
exit( wp_safe_redirect( get_permalink( $new_question ) ) );`
Then replace with the following code to redirect to home page: 
exit( wp_safe_redirect( home_url() ) );
Notice: you can use similar to redirect user to any other page as you wish (in your case to the question listing page) Eg: like this is my url :http://mysite/discussion-forum/ 
exit( wp_safe_redirect( home_url() .'discussion-forum/' ) );
About the permalink of categories, have you tried to add the permalink in the Settings of Q&A

item.title: Why can Admins no longer pin more than one post in the question page?
item.dc:creator: Vernon Dahmer
item.content:encoded: I want DWQA used to be able to "pin" up to 3 posts at a time in the question page, allowing users to see any posts we deemed important with ease. I only able to pin one post at any given time. Can someone please explain why? I'd really like it.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Up to 3 posts? I love this thought.
If you are comfortable with code, this function can do it easily.
Oh well .. it was worth a try I suppose .
Agree to you. One post is not enough and with lot of members, Important discussions are lost. Need at least two if not three options to pin important posts.
